A bus is moving horizontally on a road of width $w$. The bus is represented by a convex polygon with $n$ vertices. The bus moves to the left with a constant speed $v$.  A pedestrian starts at $(0,0)$ and wants to cross the road to $(0,w)$. The pedestrian can move vertically at a maximum speed of $u$. The pedestrian is hit by the bus if at any point they are inside the bus polygon.

Find the minimum time the pedestrian needs to cross the road without being hit by the bus. 

The input will give you the number of vertices of the bus polygon ($n$), the width of the road ($w$), the speed of the bus ($v$), and the speed of the pedestrian ($u$). It will also give you the coordinates of each vertex of the bus polygon.

A bus is moving horizontally on a road. The bus is represented by a polygon. A person starts at one edge of the road and wants to reach the other edge without being hit by the bus. The person can move vertically at a constant speed.  Find the minimum time it takes for the person to cross the road safely.
